messages.message: Thanks @mfichman . I examined every usage of `increment_by` in the codebase, none of them seem to be related to Human Review metrics for deployments. So things like how long a user spent modifying a particular field value in Human Review after the flow has been run. Based on my understanding most of the usages seem to be 1 of these: (a) metrics in aihub which can be seen under `/<aihub url>apps/metrics` by site admins, (b) metrics related to running flows, or (c) legacy
If you follow the code all it really does is reformat the api params to call `ElasticSearchQuery` in the go code, and I believe the go function just makes a call to Elastic Search to get the metrics
OK. Well, the data gets into elastic somehow so I would start there! Lmk if you canâ€™t figure it out by the end of the week.
Is there any documentation on how to view logged data in ElasticSearch for crafting env? I was also thinking of connecting to rabbitmq
